locale.message: This plugin enables the assignment of the Uniform Resource Names according to the policies of the Deutsche Nationalbibliothek.

According to the URN policy of the Deutsche Nationalbibliothek (DNB) the URNs can only be assigned to the galleys that will be archived, i.e. to the PDF galleys in the main article language.
Please do the following setup steps to be able to manage and use URNs in OJS:
The DNB URN prefix is the fix, never changing part of the URN (e.g. "urn:nbn:de:0000-").

Use the pattern entered below to generate URN suffixes. Use
  • %j for journal initials
  • %v for the volume number
  • %i for the issue number
  • %Y for the year
  • %a for the OJS article ID
  • %g for the OJS galley ID
  • %p for the page number
  • %x for "Custom Identifier" (must be enabled in Setup 4.3).
  • %P for santized version of page string
For example, vol%viss%ipp%p could create the URN suffix "vol3iss2pp230".
A URN suffix can take any form, but must be unique for each published item.

Enter an individual URN suffix for each published item independent and different from the "Custom Identifier" mentioned in the previous option. You'll find an additional URN input field on each item's metadata page.

If you change your URN configuration, URNs that have already been assigned will not be affected. Once the changed URN configuration is saved, use this button to clear all existing URNs so that the new settings will take effect with existing objects.
Are you sure you wish to delete all existing DNB URNs?
